summary: The document is a segment of an investigation file concerning the JFK assassination, focusing on a neighborhood check for Manuel Marti in the Bronx, New York. It outlines efforts to collect information from residents of an apartment building where Marti lived from 1946 to 1965, with limited success as only a few individuals provided any leads.
key_findings: The investigation was part of a broader inquiry into the JFK assassination, suggesting a potential connection or interest in Manuel Marti.
Efforts to gather information from residents of 905 East 167th Street, Bronx, New York, about Marti were largely unsuccessful, with most having no knowledge of him or his family.
Alexander Castillo, Ramona Rodriguez, and Luisa Perez were among the few identified as possible sources of information on Marti.
The document is labeled 'UNCLASSIFIED' and was released with redactions, indicating that certain details were not disclosed to the public.
